main event: A red object the size of a dime was observed in a continuous descent over Kelowna, B.C. on September 6, 1961.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 5-10 seconds,The object was reported as being red in color and small in size,Several civilian witnesses at a drive-in movie reported seeing the object,The nature of the object was classified as possibly being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon,The observation occurred at night under cloudy and hazy conditions.
sighted object: red object the size of a dime
